instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a
threads.message:
Hi,
very miner liquid damage near <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> and lcd connector area. connector and cable replaced external posting Ok. display coming bot not full see pictures tried different screens same issue any idea?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a
threads.message: Hi, no one here to help me out?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a
threads.message: Problem in the LED return lines. Check on diode mode all <SIGNAL>LED_RETURN_1</SIGNAL> through 6. One of them will be open. <RESISTOR>R9717</RESISTOR>-22 are common suspects.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R1917</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R1919</RESISTOR> found bad thank you. its fixed
